intro: Christella appendiculata, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Europe and northern Africa. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in maritime environments. Christella appendiculata is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize coastal dunes.
